ANU.name: Brendan Loo Gee
ANU.biography: Brendan is an inter-disciplinary researcher with work experience in the academia, government, and the private sector. Further, Brendan work examines the intersects of mental health, information technology and the life insurance sector.
project: Mobile mental self-awareness: Ecological Momentary Interventions for mental health. This project examines the development and implementation of a mobile app for social anxiety.

Artifical Intelligence for Life Insurance Sector: Improving the mental health of customers. This project examines the development of Artifiical Intelligence to improve life insurance services for people with mental ill-health. This project is supported by Innovation Connection, an initative by the Australian Government Department of Industry, Science, Energy and Resource.

publication.title: Suicidal thoughts, suicidal behaviours and self-harm in daily life: A systematic review of ecological momentary assessment studies

publication.source: Journal of the American Medical Informatics Association, vol. 23, no. 1, pp. 221-229
